alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 1:46AM EDT until April 07 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Flint River near Griffin affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Flint River near Griffin... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast to begin late this morning. * WHERE...Flint River near Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...Between 10 and 12 feet, Bankfull conditions occur along the river upstream and downstream from the gage at Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 9.6 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this morning to 12.4 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening to 10.1 feet and begin rising again tomorrow evening. It will rise to 10.9 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 09/19/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
